metadata.how_to_trigger: With Gale as an Avatar, or as orphaned Companion, approach the shrine of Mystra (S_LOW_MystraStatue_ab6b7142-2333-4b38-9506-fb3e72157145) and click on it.

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *There she stands. Mystra. Your goddess. Your lover. Your past. And no ordinary idol.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *Beneath the silent stone surges a relentless current of purest Weave. A summoning channel, the kind commanded by Mystra herself.*

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *How many times have you dreamed of this moment? An audience with the goddess who loved you. Who abandoned you. All you have to do is reach for it...*

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: You can do this, Gale. And I'll be right here when you're done.

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: This is one lady love you perhaps do not want to keep waiting, wizard.

58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale reaches a hand out in front of him, closes his eyes. A brilliant flash of white light and - he's in the Outer planes. Before him, Mystra in her celestial form.

72.speaker: Mystra
72.text: Gale of Waterdeep. You look well.
72.context: NodeContext: Not giving much away - both a pleasantry on an awkward reunion with her ex, and carrying the added implication of the fact Mystra told Gale to blow himself up, yet he stands before her, alive and well

112.speaker: Gale
112.text: Mystra. Please - I have so much to explain to you.

26.speaker: Mystra
26.text: There is much unsaid between us, but time runs ever short.
26.context: NodeContext: "much unsaid' carries a lot of weight - could refer to their relationship, their breakup, Gale's betrayal etc. Mystra is subtly keeping control of the conversation.

34.speaker: Mystra
34.text: I've been watching your journey here. Your triumphs. Your temptations. Your doubts.
34.context: NodeContext: Referring to the player's epic journey so far. They may have sensed Mystra's presence at an earlier point in the game, and been tempted to use evil magic she forbids her followers to use. They may also have spoken of their faltering faith in Mystra, but she has no interest in judging them for it now.

59.speaker: Mystra
59.text: You discovered what lies at the Heart of the Absolute - the Crown of Karsus - and you disobeyed my instruction. Why?
59.context: NodeContext: Big question - this was the quest Mystra gave to the player in Act 2, which they refused to complete. Mystra containing her frustration, but needs to know the answer. 'Heart of the Absolute' was the term used for what turned out to be the brain/Crown

126.speaker: Gale
126.text: Because I have someone else to live for.

62.speaker: Mystra
62.text: I know. Your union is one I find surprising, but you are your own man and it is not the worst choice you have made, after all.
62.context: NodeContext: Not news to Mystra. Partner could be any origin/custom player so it's intentionally generic. 'Worst choice' alluding to how he got the orb in his chest.

5.speaker: Gale
5.text: Because my life isn't yours to throw away. You had no right to ask that of me.

91.speaker: Mystra
91.text: You were my lover, my Chosen, yet still you know so little of me.
91.context: NodeContext: Hint of disappointment - even after all the advantages I gave you, you can't see further than your own nose

108.speaker: Gale
108.text: I was afraid. Afraid to die. Afraid that I might fail.

21.speaker: Mystra
21.text: Fear? An 'unambitious emotion', you once told me. Have you changed after all?
21.context: NodeContext: Reminding Gale of his former hubris. Not yet ready to believe he's changed.

28.speaker: Mystra
28.text: I hoped hindsight would help you see what you could not perceive before. Do you understand why I severed our connection?
28.context: NodeContext: Containing her emotions, probing to see if Gale can be trusted with her next request

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: I was a danger to you. What I did, or rather, attempted to do, was reckless.

132.speaker: Mystra
132.text: It was, more than you ever realised.
132.context: NodeContext: Not letting him off easily

92.speaker: Gale
92.text: Because I disobeyed you. You punished me for it.

104.speaker: Mystra
104.text: How so? You think I should have cured you? Erased the consequences of your actions?
104.context: NodeContext: Not impressed at Gale's characterisation of his actions and her response, but not rising to it. She's about to correct him.

102.speaker: Gale
102.text: I let you down. I was a fool, and fools don't deserve the love of a goddess.

103.speaker: Mystra
103.text: The past cannot be undone with self-pity, nor can a future be forged. Only with the truth will you see the way ahead.
103.context: NodeContext: Not letting him off easily

81.speaker: Gale
81.text: You were threatened. You realised you couldn't control me.

55.speaker: Mystra
55.text: You were many things to me, but never a threat. And never a saviour.
55.context: NodeContext: Sharper, almost a warning - don't entertain such thoughts, Gale. You won't like where they lead.

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: Our relationship bored you. The orb was just an excuse to end it.

54.speaker: Mystra
54.text: I have no need of excuses. Nonetheless, you gave me one I had no choice but to act upon.
54.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact regarding Gale's explanation. The 'excuse' he gave was the orb, she's about to explain.

69.speaker: Mystra
69.text: The fragment of magic you tried to return to me was not of my creation. It was the Karsite Weave.
69.context: NodeContext: 'Fragment of magic' referring to the orb in Gale's chest. 'Karsite Weave' with distaste - the creation of someone she hates

19.speaker: Mystra
19.text: It is a corrupted, half-born magic wrought in the brief moment Karsus ascended to godhood. It hungers for power just as he did, and it can never be sated.
19.context: NodeContext: Weighty/strong sentiment here - the Karsite Weave is an abomination in her eyes

11.speaker: Mystra
11.text: You unleashed something that would consume all magic in existence, and yet you thought only of preserving yourself.
11.context: NodeContext: 'Am I wrong?'. Referring back to Gale unleashing the orb, and then coming to Mystra to ask her to cure him of it.

43.speaker: Gale
43.text: So that's what you're scared of. The magic within me is one you can't control. But with the Crown of Karsus, I could.

107.speaker: Mystra
107.text: You can no more control the Karsite Weave than a weather vane could control a storm.
107.context: NodeContext: A personal warning for Gale, but not specifically that 'he' couldn't control it - no mortal could. Stern, warning

79.speaker: Gale
79.text: I never intended to do harm. Only to prove myself worthy of you.

13.speaker: Mystra
13.text: You were already worthy. What you lacked was patience, and it cost you dearly.
13.context: NodeContext: Hint of gentleness - recognising some of Gale's pain

20.speaker: Mystra
20.text: When the Karsite Weave entered your body, your gifts were the first thing it consumed.
20.context: NodeContext: Hint of gentleness - recognising some of Gale's pain

137.speaker: Gale
137.text: Then why did you strip me of my abilities? I could have put things right.

42.speaker: Mystra
42.text: I did no such thing, Gale.
42.context: NodeContext: Slight confusion - she didn't know this was his assumption

141.speaker: Gale
141.text: You're one to talk. How many innocents were you prepared to sacrifice if I detonated the orb?

109.speaker: Mystra
109.text: Such eddies are unexceptional. Souls arrive and depart your plane with every tide, in circumstances just and unjust.
109.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, not interested in these kinds of specifics

41.speaker: Mystra
41.text: The Weave cannot be lost because we are unwilling to cause a ripple. And that is what is at stake.
41.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, not interested in these kinds of specifics. 'The Weave' = magic.

24.speaker: Gale
24.text: Is that why you lied to me about the Crown of Karsus? Self-preservation?

71.speaker: Mystra
71.text: My concern was the preservation of everything. The Karsite Weave could tear apart the very fabric of the Material Plane.
71.context: NodeContext: A hint of anger here - Gale's selfishness is not her own, he's pissing her off by accusing her of these motives

15.speaker: Mystra
15.text: That it entered your body and consumed no more than your powers was a miracle. But we will not be granted another.
15.context: NodeContext: A hint of anger here - Gale's selfishness is not her own, he's pissing her off by accusing her of these motives. The 'miracle' is that Gale didn't do any more damage, not that he survived. Sense of foreboding on the last sentence.

97.speaker: Mystra
97.text: The only reason the 'orb' sleeps is because I have allowed it to feed on the true Weave - a temporary measure, but one that will not be enough to save us.
97.context: NodeContext: "This is what your foolishness has cost". New information for the player, who believes Mystra simply waved her hand and fixed them because it suited her.

142.speaker: Mystra
142.text: With each day that passes, the elder brain threatens to become a new kind of god, its worshippers a scourge of soulless illithids.
142.context: NodeContext: Hinting at the fact the elder brain will soon evolve, becoming free of the dead three's control. A terrible vision for the future.

110.speaker: Mystra
110.text: If you will not use the orb to end this abomination, then you must find a way to separate Crown and host. When you've done this, you must surrender the Crown of Karsus to me.

30.speaker: Mystra
30.text: Perform this service, and I will see you cured. You will be forgiven.
30.context: NodeContext: Key info for players - this is the first time they've been offered a cure,

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: You're the mother of all magic, the Weave incarnate. Can't you just destroy the Crown yourself?

9.speaker: Mystra
9.text: It is not my place to destroy another god's creation, however temporarily he joined the pantheon.
9.context: NodeContext: Hint of frustration that this is the case

101.speaker: Mystra
101.text: It must be you, Gale. You are the one who carries Karsus' power within you. You are the only one who can.
101.context: NodeContext: Hint of frustration that this is the case

128.speaker: Gale
128.text: Very well. The next time we meet, I'll be bringing you the Crown.

38.speaker: Mystra
38.text: Thank you. May the Weave's light guide your purpose, and its wisdom guide your hand.
38.context: NodeContext: A blessing - Mystra relieved you'll do it

6.speaker: Mystra
6.text: The future of magic rests on your shoulders, Gale of Waterdeep.
6.context: NodeContext: Almost like a 'knighting' vibe - she's declaring her faith in him, and believes he can do this.

31.speaker: Mystra
31.text: I promise you - it is a burden you are strong enough to bear.
31.context: NodeContext: Almost like a 'knighting' vibe - she's declaring her faith in him, and believes he can do this.

76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystra's form disappears. Gale stands in an ordinary temple before an ordinary statue once more. Mystra's idol gazes on, revealing nothing. Gale smiles to himself.

122.speaker: Gale
122.text: I understand now why you asked what you did. I should use the orb, and ensure Karsus' powers are truly destroyed.

87.speaker: Mystra
87.text: If this is the course you choose, Elysium will be waiting.
87.context: NodeContext: A promise. 'Elysium' being heaven/where Mystra resides

49.speaker: Gale
49.text: I don't need your forgiveness. The Crown of Karsus will be mine, and the Karsite Weave will obey me.

95.speaker: Mystra
95.text: Crown yourself, Gale Dekarios, and you will learn what it is to carry such weight upon your shoulders.
95.context: NodeContext: An icy edge entering her voice - a hint at the challenge Gale will face if he pursues this course

121.speaker: Mystra
121.text: If it does not crush you, I will.
121.context: NodeContext: Here we glimpse the true, unimaginable power of Mystra. She's still in control of herself, but her anger should be palpable.

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: I don't know. I need time to think.

61.speaker: Mystra
61.text: So be it. Follow the needle of your own wisdom. We shall see how truly it leads you.
61.context: NodeContext: Neutral - not impressed he hasn't outright agreed to what she asked, but willing to give him the time he needs.

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: No wizard worth their hat would destroy such a powerful artefact without first understanding it.

127.speaker: Mystra
127.text: And you believe you have the right to such an understanding?
127.context: NodeContext: Hint of an eyebrow raise - is this a sign of Gale's same old hubris?

117.speaker: Gale
117.text: I owe you no explanation. Not after how you've treated me.

93.speaker: Mystra
93.text: You still believe yourself to be so wronged? You always were stubborn.
93.context: NodeContext: Hint of an eyebrow raise - is this a sign of Gale's same old hubris?

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: You break up with me, cut me off from the Weave, leave me to die, and that's all you have to say? 'You look well'?

123.speaker: Mystra
123.text: I did not come here to suffer a mortal's admonitions. Certainly not yours.
123.context: NodeContext: restrained, but taking no nonsense

2.speaker: Gale
2.text: What can I say? Adventuring suits me.

135.speaker: Mystra
135.text: It always did. Though the ones we shared were far sweeter than those you've tasted recently.
135.context: NodeContext: Alluding to the wider plot of the story - that Gale's recently been infected with a tadpole etc. Not overly nostalgic here - she's invoking the 'sweetness' in comparison to the recent chaos Gle's endured, not because she's remembering the sweetness herself

47.speaker: Mystra
47.text: Tactful as ever. But now it is only your candour I require.
47.context: NodeContext: 'Tactful' referring just to how he's handling the situation with dignity. Mystra in control of the conversation.

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: I didn't come for small talk. Why did you summon me?

136.speaker: Mystra
136.text: I see you lost your manners, along with the greatest of your gifts.
136.context: NodeContext: Not really rising to it, but the slightest hint of an eyebrow raise. She's here for more important things that such bickering.

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: I didn't call on you to make small talk. You owe me an explanation.

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *Something in the air grows colder. Sharper. Mystra's patience is extensive, but not infinite. She will not wait forever.*

14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
14.text: Your goddess awaits. Hear her out, but remember that you do not owe her obedience, and you certainly do not owe her your life.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: Your goddess calls. Serve her or denounce her as you will - but you cannot ignore her.

83.speaker: Wyll
83.text: Go on, my good man - your goddess awaits. Let us pray that good wisdom prevails.

124.speaker: Shadowheart
124.text: Go on, Gale - see what Mystra has to say for herself. She was never deserving of your worship, anyway.
124.context: NodeContext: Encouraging  Gale. 'Standing up to a goddess' = SH has turned from Shar. 'see what Mystra...' = SH loyal to Shar (Mystra is typically not a popular goddess with Shar worshippers)

131.speaker: Astarion
131.text: Well? Go on, then - it's rude to keep a goddess waiting.

133.speaker: Minsc
133.text: Eh... the first step is difficult, of course. Minsc could throw you in, if you prefer?

139.speaker: Halsin
139.text: Speak your mind, Gale. Let go of that weight you have been carrying for Mystra.

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Just as Elminster promised, you stand before no ordinary idol.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *Just as Elminster promised, Gale stands before no ordinary idol.*
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks up at Mystra's statue, his face unreadable

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *All he has to do is reach for it...*

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *There she stands. Mystra. Gale's goddess. His lover. His past. And no ordinary idol.*
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks up at Mystra's statue, his face unreadable

74.speaker: Gale
74.text: Mystra. I never thought we'd speak again like this. Why am I here?

148.speaker: Gale
148.text: No thanks to you. I wasn't expecting a summons, but then you did always prefer things on your terms.

80.speaker: Gale
80.text: As do you. But I assume we're not here solely to exchange compliments. So, why am I here?

39.speaker: Gale
39.text: I didn't want to die. And when I saw the Crown, I thought I might not have to, if I only understood its power.

99.speaker: Gale
99.text: That can't be. It wasn't - it couldn't have been. I only wished to prove myself worthy. I had no idea...

12.speaker: Gale
12.text: Well somebody had to. You weren't exactly forthcoming with any offers of help.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: I won't let you down again. When the Absolute is vanquished, I will surrender Karsus' powers to you. You have my word.

106.speaker: Gale
106.text: Not happening. When I get my hands on that Crown, I'm going to wield it. Karsus' powers will be mine.

116.speaker: Gale
116.text: A great ask indeed. You've given me much to think on - as you always did.

119.speaker: Gale
119.text: So that's what you're scared of. With the Crown of Karsus reforged, I could take control of the Karsite Weave.

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: You abandoned me in my hour of greatest need. I had no obligation to help you in yours.

114.speaker: Gale
114.text: Because you had no right to ask that of me. You cast me out, remember?
